Reviews.Title: Hidden gem
Reviews.Author: Foglifter
Reviews.Content: This is a truly unlocked international phone, the UI can be set to any language from the long list. It's sad and understandable why Samsung won't sell it in US as it is twice as cheaper than its big brother Galaxy S III. The screen is gorgeous, the phone is very fast and responsive. The size of this baby is perfect for both men and women, unless one prefers all those "bricks" with huge screens. I love this phone!

Reviews.Title: Galaxy S III mini
Reviews.Author: shell
Reviews.Content: I've heard a lot of back and forth reviews on this.  I love this phone.  I live in the U.S. and i have consumer cellular as my phone provider.  I bought this phone, stuck my sim card in it, and had no trouble at all setting it up.  All i had to do was go through initial set up steps like language settings (it was in English (ireland) and i changed it to english (united states)).  Connected to our WIFI and the WIFI at my work without any problems...this phone amazes me with what it can do in a phone that's not overly bulky.  My brother got one of these as well and i set it up exactly like mine without a single problem.

Reviews.Title: Seller, SurgeTelecom, switched models and sent bogus phone
Reviews.Author: Traveler2014
Reviews.Content: I researched this product and looked forward to receiving it.  I even paid a fee for fast delivery.  However, the seller, SurgeTelecom, sent the same model number but with an "L" at the end of the model number.  The "L" means the telephone is configured for Latin America and it is NOT the telephone I ordered.  I tried to use the phone in the U.S. but its speed never went over EDGE or H because the phone is not configured for the U.S.Even though the phone I received has the same model number as this phone EXCEPT FOR THE "L" AT THE END, the "L" model phone is quite different.  As I wrote, it is configured for Latin America.  The box the telephone came in showed that the phone was manufactured in Vietnam and most of the writing on the box is in Spanish.  Worse, however, is the fact that the phone with the "L" requires a mini SIM card while this model requires a standard SIM. That makes a huge difference.I will be ordering again and hopefully, a different seller will not substitute my order with a phone that is configured for a totally different geographic area.A friend has this phone (the one I ordered, but not the wrong one I received from the seller, SurgeTelecom.  The phone is great and is perfect for my needs.UPDATE -I returned the wrong phone that I received (discussed above).  I then ordered a replacement phone and, INCREDIBLY, I received another phone with the "L" after the model number and the wrong size SIM card.  This makes two separate times I received the wrong phone within one month.  Be careful when ordering.  Even though the model number you receive is correct, if the model number has an "L" after it, the phone will not work properly in the U.S.Doesn't anyone bother to check items before they are shipped?

Reviews.Title: My new favorite Travel Phone
Reviews.Author: D. Seda
Reviews.Content: Truly unlocked and so far have tried a SIM from ATT and one other generic in NY, USA.  Also worked in the Philippines and I will test this winter in Thailand.  No issues starting up, inserting new SIM was easy and had incredibly awesome reception (ironically better than in the states).  I traveled with an old unlocked T-Mobile GSM phone for over 15 years but now with smartphones and SIM cards having included data plans I made the jump to a smart phone for traveling.  I'm truly satisfied with this purchase and highly recommended this model phone.  Minor differences with the standard Samsung iii but I don't mind (tap phones to transmit data isn't on this model etc...).  The price is unbeatable as I attempted to purchase this one week prior on a trip to France and it was literally double the amount!  Battery life excellent and size is a lot more comfortable to hold/carry than my standard S3.  I personally prefer the size of the mini over the new trend of brick size phones. One note: this is a GSM phone which will not work on CDMA systems so you will not be able to use this with Verizon, Sprint, Metro PCS and some others ONLY GSM.  Hopefully this review helps.

Reviews.Title: At first I was scare, but then everything has been really good!!
Reviews.Author: Javier R. "Javiercaracas"
Reviews.Content: It has been 2 weeks since I bought this smartphone. At this time, I'm enjoying big time the perfect size of this phone (S3 and S4 are just too big for me), it is not heavy, good speed, very elegant design and a lot of apps to enjoy.First time, when I turned it on, the language was set in French (there was a note from the seller inside the box giving instructions about how to change the language from French to the one you need). It was pretty easy to change the language and a big list of languages, including English and Spanish.Also, there was a note in the box saying that "this phone DOES NOT work with SPRINT or VERIZON". On the other hand, I'm from Venezuela and it works fine with MOVISTAR. The signal shows "H" which I think is better than 3G (I'm not too good with this terms). My phone does not have any AT&T; or other logos, just the Samsung Logo like it should be.The first 3 days, I was worried because sometimes it shutted down by itself (it started shutting down once or twice a day until at least 5 times a day at the end). Then, I searched on the web about this issue and turns out that I was not the only one. In some cases, people said that the phone shutted down and never start again... they called it "sudden death" and said that Samsung was already aware and working on this issue... AT THAT TIME I WAS SCARED!! I found an app that tells you if your phone is between  those related to the sudden death issue but thank God i was not in the list.Trying to fix this issue, I found out some people saying that they fixed it using the factory data reset and updating to the latest official Android Version 4.1.2. With this info and knowing that may be some of the apps I downloaded could also be the reason of the failure, I decided to make the factory data reset. Even I wrote to the seller asking for help and he quickly answered me suggesting exactly the same solution.At this time, the phone is not shutting down by itself anymore (not even once!) and I'm very happy with my new smartphone.I'm not rating with 5 star because battery does not last one day (and I don't use it the entire day). I may suggest you to buy the car charger, the quick start guide is in French and also camera should be improved ( I don't like when pictures look blur even when you are doing an effort to avoid any movement).

I've had it for 2 days now and I have determined that the name and look are all the S3 and S3 mini have in common. it's got a slow processor, only a 5mp camera (instead of 8) a VGA front facing camera (disappointing to say the least) and it's missing features that it was advertised as having. (burst/best photos, cartoon hdr and the ability to watch videos while texting.) When compared to it's competition (the Droid mini which has a 10 mp camera and the Iphone 5c which as an 8mp camera,) the Galaxy S3 mini doesn't even stand a chance at competing. I'm going to go back to verizon and I'm going to get a moto droid mini instead.

Reviews.Title: Impressive phone

Reviews.Content: This phone is worth considering if you like the Samsung Galaxy SIII but not the size. This phone is very smooth and full featured. I won't repeat the specs as they are all over the place. I will say, the build quality is solid. Battery life is a daily charger, but it makes it through on normal use. Heavy users might need a little charge time in the middle of the day. The Touchwiz interface has improved so much since the days of the original Galaxy S phones. This phone is about the same size ans shape as the Captivate but the performance is way beyond the Captivate ever way (without upgrading the ROM from stock). JellyBean makes this phone a perfect daily driver for those who want the power but not the size. It is a great compromise in my opinion. Make sure you check the hardware spec as this phone does not have all of the same sensors as the full sized SIII. For me, the sensors it had were more than enough. Others might disagree if they need NFC.

Reviews.Title: Great Costumer Service
Reviews.Author: Adrian
Reviews.Content: The first phone that they send us had troubles with the screen (some weird stripes appeared from time to time), and the Internet connection was also slower (never able to get the 3G). We noticed all this two days after it arrived, so it was still on warranty.Therefore, we completed a form in the web page (rma.blisswireless.com) that they send with the phone. We indicated that we were having technical problems, and that we wanted a replacement. Next day we received an email asking for the order number and the day afterwards another one saying that a new phone was just sent. No more questions needed.We received the replacement in 4 bussines days. This new phone works perfectly, no technical issues whatsoever and gets really fast Internet. It is completely unlocked and new, it even comes in the original box.We sent them back the first phone in a prepaid USPS, so the whole replacement had no costs for us at all. I was really impressed how easy it was to replace it.The phone is really cool, and the costumer service is really good.

Reviews.Title: Do I have a lemon?
Reviews.Author: DCJL
Reviews.Content: Pretty, nice size.  Unable to connect to a Samsung Account.  Samsung said I need to know country of origin. Seller does not "understand" the question. Without that I cannot get a verification code needed for the account. Understand you need such an account to have Samsung apps.  Seller no help.  Have sen Tried to return, but no luck after the 30 days was up.I mistakenly thought I had an Amazon buyer protection purchase.  Other than that, I also had some problems with the camera transferring photos to my computer in a Firefox photo format.Firefox is not a recognized format for any programs.  Also called other Samsung sellers.  No one has heard of that format for photos. It is known as a browser.  Had computer checked out and it is okay.  Phone may be defective.  It is the seller's option to stand behind the product, but they are choosing not to do anything.  Also asked if it is refurbished phone, no answer.  I am sure if there are no problems with the phone, I would be very happy with it. I have spent many hours attempting to overcome the issues with no success.

Maybe because I live in a big city (Atlanta), and the towers are completed, not sure.AS for the phone, I had it for a week and I like it thus far. I had a HTC before, this is my first Samsung device. I feel like the battery drains a little faster than my HTC. I had issues with wifi connecting, so I googled some of the issues and it works fine now. I really like the phone so far, just have to get used to the slightly different software. Buy it, you will not be disappointed, unless you really want to spend $600 on those high-end phones, which I don't see the need for.

Reviews.Title: I am very happy with this phone.
Reviews.Author: lingomanaz
Reviews.Content: I am graduation from a mytouch 4g.  I was worried about some of the descriptions describing 3g speed, but have not noticed it being any slower than the mytouch "4g"  on internet related things.The only con is S-voice.  It's a barely ok voice dialing system.  It's based on google search, and gives you the same useless prompts.  If you aren't looking at the phone, you won't know whether you're supposed to be waiting, talking or trying again.I finally disabled S-voice and am now using Utter.  Although it's not perfect as of this writing, it's way better than S-Voice.  Genius on the mytouch 4g was a vastly superior voice dialer to both products.Unfortunately, the mytouch appears abandoned at Android 2.2  All the cool stuff come in at Android 4.1 so I had to upgrade.Other than S-Voice, the Samsung S3 mini is a wonderful phone with an excellent battery life and many capabilities.  I also like it's form factor.  It's small enough that people won't mistake it for a small chopping board or serving tray.Also note that Android 4.1 and above doesn't support flash, so there are many websites and videos that aren't accessible without going through major trouble.  (side load flash, download firefox and enable.)  Can't blame that on Samsung though.Samsung's proprietary software is a bit tiresome and intrusive, but it's easily disabled in settings.

Reviews.Title: NO S3 just S only.
Reviews.Author: JM Boyd "JMB"
Reviews.Content: Please people this is No where close to any S3 in your wildest dreams especially after looking at the benchmarks. Marketing Always!It actually performs WORSE than the Samsung Victory and is WAY underpowered even by the S2.I always look at benchmarks first to see what your getting for your money and this one is poor.If you like it fine but don't be fooled by the name.Using Performance Benchmarks lets you see EXACTLY where these cells fit in the power and performance range. You can download the Passmark from Google Play test yourself and run several for an average but make sure all open Apps are closed and reboot once. Then about 15 to 100 people submit these Benchmarks for every phone around and the guys Average them out so they are right on. Individual tests for CPU, Disk and Memory reads & writes, with 2D & 3D Video comprise the OVERALL Passmark System Performance. Seems to be that around 2000 Passmark is the perfect match for great performance overall.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~PASSMARK SYSTEM PERFORMANCE is as follows:~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~LG Optimus V @ 537Old HTC One V @ 1100Samsung Reverb/Ring @ 1324 (identical internals)Samsung GT-I8190 (Mini S3) @ 1320Samsung Victory (SPH-L300) @ 1608Samsung Galaxy S2 (SPH-D710) @ 1788Samsung Galaxy S3 (SPH-L710) @ 2074Google LG Nexus 4 @ 2556Google LG Nexus 5 @ 3768IPhone 4S @ 1600IPhone 5 @ 3612~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~CPU RATING is as follows:~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~LG Optimus V @ 564Old HTC One V @ 1370Samsung Reverb/Ring @ 1720 (identical internals)Samsung GT-I8190 (Mini S3) @ 3133Samsung Victory @ 3948Samsung Galaxy S2 @ 4300Samsung Galaxy S3 @ 4795Google LG Nexus 4 @ 9757Google LG Nexus 5 @ 13,996IPhone 4S @ 8867IPhone 5 @ 22,693

Reviews.Title: phone is amazing.  the only drawback is that half the advertised 8GB internal memory is taken up by system files and the OS; onl
Reviews.Author: tony meinert
Reviews.Content: phone is amazing.  the only drawback is that half the advertised 8GB internal memory is taken up by system files and the OS; only 4 GB is available for additional storage.  the SD card slot comes in very handy.  i am using this in the US; just swithched from 14 yrs of verizon to Sraight talk byop plan with an at&t; sim card.  had it switched in 15 minutes.  my wife has been on straight talk for a few years.  i had a motorola droid x...this samsung is pretty sharp, runs faster, and has a much detter display.... great for the money.  I had a little issue with mms settings, but got if fixed with minimal fuss....the phone lets you change them easily.  it fits good in my hand. and i can put it in my shirt or pants pocket. i hate these huge tablet pones coming out now and i refuse to get a belt clip.  the sound is good coming out of the speaker and the  interface is easy to use too

Reviews.Title: SUPERB!!
Reviews.Author: NewmS
Reviews.Content: First off, thumbs up for the seller, very accurate!  Now, this device is truly amazing!  Completely new and unlocked, and the UI is incredible.  Running on JB, users might not need any customization, however, I did install Next Launcher 3D just to check the smoothness and all I can say is...WOW! Pebble blue color is pretty much the same as its bigger brother, S3.  The wifi is great and fast, network reception is too awesome, camera, I must say pretty impressive.  Now for gaming, this device with dual core can take some pretty heavy graphics.  I installed Shadowgun deadzone and this device delivered!  People crying about this device being laggy, totally not true, and the battery is decent, but I am always using it, either with games, music, or the camera/video. The battery will last you about 2 days with normal use. Durability is great! Already dropped it a couple of times, of course with the Dual Armor Case equipped, and not a single scratch.  TRUST me when I say that this device is worth buying, you'll come to find that for a mid-range phone, the little brother of the S3 can INDEED deliver heavy kicks!! Recommendations thrown out to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: Does not work in Peru!
Reviews.Author: Howard R. Kramer
Reviews.Content: I bought the mini since I wanted a smaller decent unlocked cell phone for use in Peru. I recognized from the reviews that it is a model for Europe but I (mis)understood that it would function well world-wide. I was in the US when I received the phone and it worked well with an ATT sim card, but when I got to Lima, I installed Claro and Movistar sim cards, and could get no better signal than edge or 2G. I brought it to two technicians here, including Samsung, and was told by both that this model does not have an 'L" that means it would be fully functional in Latin America. Obviously I'm extremely disappointed and cannot return the phone from here.
